title: The root schema
description: The root schema comprises the entire JSON document.

description.title: Preset Name
description.description: A short name to describe this preset.

name.title: Player Name
name.description: The name you want to appear in the game. This only matters for multiworld games, but it still mandatory.

glitches_required.title: Glitches Required
glitches_required.description: When generating the game, required items may be placed in locations that require knowing certain glitches to access. Here, you may choose the level of glitch knowledge which may be required to complete your game.

none.title: No Glitches
none.description: All required items will be placed in locations which do not require any glitch knowledge to access.

minor_glitches.title: Minor Glitches
minor_glitches.description: Required items may be placed in locations which require knowledge of minor glitches to access.

overworld_glitches.title: Overworld Glitches
overworld_glitches.description: Required items may be placed in locations which require knowledge of overworld glitches to access.

no_logic.title: No Logic
no_logic.description: Required items may be placed in any location in the world, with no regard to logical access. Be aware, this may do things like put the Fire Rod on Trinexx

meta_ignore.title: The meta_ignore schema
meta_ignore.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

mode.title: Game Mode
mode.description: Ignore meta rules for Game Mode.

map_shuffle.title: Map Shuffle
map_shuffle.description: Shuffles dungeon maps throughout the world. Dungeon pendant/crystal rewards will be hidden on the overworld map until you find the corresponding dungeon's map.

compass_shuffle.title: Compass Shuffle
compass_shuffle.description: Shuffles compasses throughout the world. Finding a dungeon's compass will cause an item counter to be displayed in the corresponding dungeon.

smallkey_shuffle.title: Small Key Shuffle
smallkey_shuffle.description: Shuffle small keys from dungeons throughout the world.

universal.title: Universal Small Keys
universal.description: In addition to being placed throughout the world, all small keys are also made universal, similar to retry mode. This also allows you to purchase them in shops.

bigkey_shuffle.title: Big Key Shuffle
bigkey_shuffle.description: Shuffle dungeon big keys throughout the world.

local_keys.title: Local Keys
local_keys.description: Force all keys to be placed in your own world. Irrelevant in single-player seeds.

on.title: On
on.description: Turn on the local keys setting.

off.title: Off
off.description: Turn off the local keys setting.

dungeon_counters.title: Dungeon Counters
dungeon_counters.description: Choose how and when to show an item count for checks available within a dungeon.

on.title: On
on.description: Always display the number of completed checks in a dungeon.

pickup.title: Pickup
pickup.description: Show the check counter only after the dungeon's compass has been picked up.

default.title: Default
default.description: Do not show the dungeon's check counter unless compasses are shuffled and the corresponding dungeon compass has been acquired.

accessibility.title: Accessibility
accessibility.description: Determine the availability of item checks and locations.

items.title: Items
items.description: Guarantees you will be able to acquire all items, but not necessarily access all locations in the game.

locations.title: Locations
locations.description: Guarantees you will be able to access all locations, and therefore all items in the game.

none.title: None
none.description: Guarantees only that the game is beatable. Not all items may be available, and not all locations may be accessable.

progressive.title: Progressive Items
progressive.description: Enable or disable progressive items throughout the game.

on.title: On
on.description: All items with multiple tiers will be progressive (swords, shields, bow, gloves).

off.title: Off
off.description: All items will be non-progressive. You might find the Golden Sword in Link's house.

random.title: Random
random.description: Decide whether to shuffle each tiered item independently. Swords might be progressive while gloves are not.

entrance_shuffle.title: Entrance Shuffle
entrance_shuffle.description: Determine the frequency and complexity with which entrances are shuffled with one another.

none.title: No Shuffle
none.description: All entrances lead to their vanilla locations.

dungeonssimple.title: Dungeons Simple
dungeonssimple.description: Shuffles only dungeons amongst each other, swapping dungeons entirely. So Hyrule Castle is always one dungeon, for example.

dungeonsfull.title: Dungeons Full
dungeonsfull.description: Shuffle any dungeon entrance with any dungeon interior, so Hyrule Castle might lead to four dungeons.

simple.title: Simple
simple.description: Entrances are grouped together before being randomized. Simple imposes the most strict grouping rules.

insanity.title: Insanity
insanity.description: Very few grouping rules. Good luck.

goals.title: Goals
goals.description: Determine the final goal of your game.

ganon.title: Ganon
ganon.description: Acquire all required crystals to enter Ganaon's Tower and defeat Agahnim, then defeat Ganon.

fast_ganon.title: Fast Ganon
fast_ganon.description: Ganon's pyramid is open from the start of the game, and you must defeat him, but there is a minimum crystal requirement to be able to damage him.

dungeons.title: All Dungeons
dungeons.description: Acquire all pendants and crystals, defeat Agahnim in both Hyrule Castle Tower and Ganon's Tower, and defeat Ganon in his pyramid.

pedestal.title: Pedestal
pedestal.description: Acquire all three pendants and pull the Master Sword from its pedestal.

triforce_hunt.title: Triforce Hunt
triforce_hunt.description: The triforce has been broken into pieces and you must find them, then turn them in to Murahadala, who is standing in front of Hyrule Castle.

local_triforce_hunt.title: Local Triforce Hunt
local_triforce_hunt.description: Same as triforce hunt, but all the triforce pieces are guaranteed to be in your world. Irrelevant to single-player games.

ganon_triforce_hunt.title: Triforce Hunt /w Ganon
ganon_triforce_hunt.description: The triforce of courage has been broken and the pieces are scattered around Hyrule. Link must find them, then face Ganon in his pyramid.

local_ganon_triforce_hunt.title: Local Triforce Hunt /w Ganon
local_ganon_triforce_hunt.description: Same as Triforce Hunt /w Ganon, but all the triforce pieces are guaranteed to be in your world. Irrelevant to single-player games.

triforce_pieces_available.title: Triforce Pieces Available
triforce_pieces_available.description: Determines how many Triforce pieces are placed throughout the world. Irrelevant unless a Triforce Hunt goal is chosen.

20.description: 20 Triforce pieces will be placed throughout the world.

25.description: 25 Triforce pieces will be placed throughout the world.

30.description: 30 Triforce pieces will be placed throughout the world.

35.description: 35 Triforce pieces will be placed throughout the world.

40.description: 40 Triforce pieces will be placed throughout the world.

45.description: 45 Triforce pieces will be placed throughout the world.

50.description: 50 Triforce pieces will be placed throughout the world.

triforce_pieces_required.title: Triforce Pieces Required
triforce_pieces_required.description: The number of triforce pieces you must find before you may complete the game by speaking with Murahadala. Irrelevant unless a Triforce Hunt goal is chosen.

15.description: 15 Triforce pieces are required to complete the game.

20.description: 20 Triforce pieces are required to complete the game.

25.description: 25 Triforce pieces are required to complete the game.

30.description: 30 Triforce pieces are required to complete the game.

35.description: 35 Triforce pieces are required to complete the game.

40.description: 40 Triforce pieces are required to complete the game.

tower_open.title: Tower Open
tower_open.description: How many crystals will be required to open Ganon's Tower?

0.title: 0 Crystals
0.description: 0 Crystals are required to open Ganon's Tower.

1.title: 1 Crystal
1.description: 1 Crystal is required to open Ganon's Tower.

2.title: 2 Crystals
2.description: 2 Crystals are required to open Ganon's Tower.

3.title: 3 Crystals
3.description: 3 Crystals are required to open Ganon's Tower.

4.title: 4 Crystals
4.description: 4 Crystals are required to open Ganon's Tower.

5.title: 5 Crystals
5.description: 5 Crystals are required to open Ganon's Tower.

6.title: 6 Crystals
6.description: 6 Crystals are required to open Ganon's Tower.

7.title: 7 Crystals
7.description: 7 Crystals are required to open Ganon's Tower.

random.title: Random
random.description: A random number from 0-7 crystals will be required to open Ganon's Tower.

ganon_open.title: Ganon Vulnerable
ganon_open.description: How many crystals are required to harm Ganon?

0.title: 0 Crystals
0.description: 0 Crystals are required to harm Ganon.

1.title: 1 Crystal
1.description: 1 Crystal is required to harm Ganon.

2.title: 2 Crystals
2.description: 2 Crystals are required to harm Ganon.

3.title: 3 Crystals
3.description: 3 Crystals are required to harm Ganon.

4.title: 4 Crystals
4.description: 4 Crystals are required to harm Ganon.

5.title: 5 Crystals
5.description: 5 Crystals are required to harm Ganon.

6.title: 6 Crystals
6.description: 6 Crystals are required to harm Ganon.

7.title: 7 Crystals
7.description: 7 Crystals are required to harm Ganon.

random.title: Random
random.description: A random number from 0-7 crystals will be required to harm Ganon.

mode.title: Game Mode
mode.description: Choose a game mode to play. This may affect the world state.

standard.title: Standard
standard.description: Begin the game by rescuing Zelda from her cell.

open.title: Open
open.description: Begin the game from your choice of Link's House or the Sanctuary.

inverted.title: Inverted
inverted.description: Begin in the dark world. The Moon Pearl is required to avoid bunny-state in Light World, and the Light World game map is altered.

retro.title: Retro Mode
retro.description: Make the game similar to Zelda 1. All small keys are universal and may be purchased in shops, the quiver must be purchased in a shop, take-any caves are added to the overworld, and you may need to find your old-man cave to acquire a sword.

hints.title: Item Hints
hints.description: Determine what type of hints will be given in-game.

on.title: On
on.description: Hint tiles will tell you the location of items.

off.title: Off
off.description: Hint tiles will give gameplay tips.

weapons.title: The weapons schema
weapons.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

randomized.title: Randomized
randomized.description: Swords are placed randomly throughout the world.

assured.title: Assured
assured.description: Begin the game with a sword. The others are placed randomly throughout the world.

vanilla.title: Vanilla
vanilla.description: Swords are located at their vanilla game locations.

swordless.title: Swordless
swordless.description: Swords are removed from the item pool.

item_pool.title: Item Pool
item_pool.description: Add or remove helpful items from the game.

easy.title: Easy
easy.description: Doubled availability of upgrades, progressive, items, etc.

normal.title: Normal
normal.description: Item availability unchanged from the vanilla game.

hard.title: Hard
hard.description: Reduced upgrade availability (max: 14 hearts, blue mail, tempered sword, fire shield, no silvers unless swordless)

expert.title: Expert
expert.description: Minimum upgrade availability (max: 8 hearts, green mail, master sword, fighter shield, no silvers unless swordless)

crowd_control.title: Crowd Control
crowd_control.description: Sets up the item pool for the crowd control extension. Do not use it without crowd control.

hard.title: Hard
hard.description: Reduced helpfulness of items (potions less effective, can't catch faeries, Magic Cape uses double magic, Cane of Byrna does not grant invulnerability, boomerangs do not stun, silvers disabled outside ganon)

expert.title: Expert
expert.description: Vastly reduces the helpfulness of items (potions barely effective, can't catch faeries, Magic Cape uses double magic, Cane of Byrna does not grant invulnerability, boomerangs and hookshot do not stun, silvers disabled outside ganon)

progression_balancing.title: Progression Balancing
progression_balancing.description: Whether the generator should attempt to put required items in earlier spheres.

boss_shuffle.title: Boss Shuffle
boss_shuffle.description: Choose how and when bosses should be shuffled around dungeons.

none.title: None
none.description: Bosses are left in their vanilla locations.

simple.title: Simple
simple.description: Existing bosses are shuffled throughout dungeons.

full.title: Full
full.description: Shuffles all bosses, including those in Ganon's Tower across dungeons.

random.title: Random
random.description: Any boss can occur any number of times.

singularity.title: Singularity
singularity.description: Randomly chooses a boss and tries to put it everywhere. Puts other bosses in locations the chosen boss cannot exist.

killable_thieves.title: Killable Thieves
killable_thieves.description: Determines whether or not thieves are able to be killed.

tile_shuffle.title: Tile Shuffle
tile_shuffle.description: Randomize the tile layout of rooms where tiles fly at you.

bush_shuffle.title: Bush Shuffle
bush_shuffle.description: Determines if bushes should randomly have enemies hiding beneath them.

on.title: On
on.description: Bushes will randomly have enemies hiding beneath them.

off.title: Off
off.description: Bushes will have enemies hiding beneath them only in vanilla locations.

enemy_damage.title: Enemy Damage
enemy_damage.description: Changes how much damage enemies deal to Link.

default.title: Default
default.description: Enemies deal vanilla damage to Link.

shuffled.title: Shuffled
shuffled.description: Enemies deal 0-4 hearts of damage and armor may reduce this amount.

random.title: Random
random.description: Enemies deal 0-8 hearts of damage and armor re-shuffles the damage amount.

enemy_health.title: Enemy Health
enemy_health.description: Determines how much damage enemies can take before they die.

pot_shuffle.title: Pot Shuffle
pot_shuffle.description: Determine if keys, items, and buttons hidden beneath pots in dungeons will have their locations randomized.

beemizer.title: Beemizer
beemizer.description: Remove items from the global pool and replace them with single bees and bee traps.

1.title: Level 1
1.description: 25% of the non-essential item pool is replaced with bee traps.

2.title: Level 2
2.description: 60% of the non-essential item pool is replaced with bee traps, of which 20% could be single bees.

3.title: Level 3
3.description: 100% of the non-essential item pool is replaced with bee traps, of which 50% could be single bees.

4.title: Level 4
4.description: 100% of the non-essential item pool is replaced with bee traps.

shop_shuffle.title: Shop Shuffle
shop_shuffle.description: Change the inventory if shops throughout the game

u.title: Capacity Upgrades
u.description: Shuffle capacity upgrades into the item pool.

ip.title: Inventory and Prices
ip.description: Shuffle the inventory and prices of shops.

uip.title: Upgrades, Inventory, and Prices
uip.description: Shuffle the inventory and prices of shops, and shuffle capacity upgrades into the item pool.

timer.title: Timer
timer.description: Settings for the game timer. May impact the item pool.

timed.title: Timed
timed.description: Starts with clock at zero. Green clocks subtract 4 minutes (total 20). Blue clocks subtract 2 minutes (total 10). Red clocks add two minutes (total 10). Winner is the player with the lowest time at the end.

timed_ohko.title: Timed OHKO
timed_ohko.description: Starts the clock at ten minutes. Green clocks add five minutes (total 25). As long as the clock as at zero, Link will die in one hit.

ohko.title: OHKO
ohko.description: Timer always at zero. Permanent OHKO.

timed_countdown.title: Timed Countdown
timed_countdown.description: Starts the clock with forty minutes. Same clocks as timed mode, but if the clock hits zero you lose. You can still keep playing, though.

display.title: Display
display.description: Displays a timer, but otherwise does not affect gameplay or the item pool.

glitch_boots.title: Glitch Boots
glitch_boots.description: Start with Pegasus Boots in glitched logic which makes use of them.

door_shuffle.title: Door Shuffle
door_shuffle.description: These options will only be used if the host generates the seed using the doors branch.

vanilla.title: Vanilla
vanilla.description: All doors lead to their vanilla destination.

crossed.title: Crossed
crossed.description: Dungeons are shuffled across each other.

rom.title: ROM Options
rom.description: Options which affect the aesthetics of your game, but not gameplay.

sprite.title: Sprite
sprite.description: Choose which character to play as.

random.title: Random
random.description: Your sprite will be chosen randomly.

randomonhit.title: Random on Hit
randomonhit.description: Your sprite changes every time you take damage.

link.title: Link
link.description: Play as the vanilla Link sprite.

disablemusic.title: Disable Music
disablemusic.description: Disables all in-game music. Sound effects will still be played.

quickswap.title: Item Quick Swap
quickswap.description: Swap between items using the L+R buttons.

menuspeed.title: Menu Speed
menuspeed.description: Alter the animation speed of the in-game menu.

instant.title: Instant
instant.description: In-game menu appears and disappears instantly.

double.title: Double
double.description: In-game menu animations are double speed.

triple.title: Triple
triple.description: In-game menu animations are triple speed.

quadruple.title: Quadruple
quadruple.description: In-game menu animations are quadruple speed.

half.title: Half
half.description: In-game menu animations are half speed.

heartcolor.title: Heart Color
heartcolor.description: Change the color of Link's heart meter.

red.title: Red
red.description: Hearts are red, as in the vanilla game.

random.title: Random
random.description: Heart color is chosen at random from the above options.

heartbeep.title: Heart Beep Frequency
heartbeep.description: Alter the frequency of the alarm which plays when Link as at low health.

double.title: Double Speed
double.description: Heart beeps play at double speed.

normal.title: Normal
normal.description: Heart beep plays at the vanilla speed.

half.title: Half Speed
half.description: Heart beep plays at half speed.

quarter.title: Quarter Speed
quarter.description: Heart beep plays at one quarter speed.

off.title: Off
off.description: Heart beep will never be played.

ow_palettes.title: Overworld Palette
ow_palettes.description: Change the colors of the overworld palette.

default.title: Default
default.description: No not change the overworld color palette.

blackout.title: Blackout
blackout.description: Change all colors on the overworld palette to black. Never use this.

uw_palettes.title: Underworld Palette
uw_palettes.description: Change the color of the underworld palette (caves, dungeons, etc.)

default.title: Default
default.description: No not change the underworld color palette.

blackout.title: Blackout
blackout.description: Change all colors on the underworld palette to black. Never use this.
